channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing dog bin by green space, 27th November
item.description:
Dog bin requires emptying. Dog waste being stacked on top. Just outside the fenced triangle of grass next to the Golden Valley Bridge (farm side)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Burnfield Pirton Lane, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trench at Edge of road, 27th November
item.description:
Edge of road has been squashed by heavy vehicles leaving a trench deep enough to cause Loss of control if a vehicle strays to the edge of the road. Accident yesterday (28/Nov) at this location where sparks were seen under a van which then span out of control and collided with other vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction line markings needed, 27th November
item.description:
Junction of Glencairn Court with Glencairn Park Road. No markings at all as existing. Exiting Glencairn Court onto Glencairn Park Road is a blind left turn, so some junction line markings would help to slow traffic down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Glencairn Court, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not working, 26th November
item.description:
The street light opposite 40 Merlin Way is not working
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 12 Merlin Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain outside of 43 Wyman's Lane opposite Swindon village park, 26th November
item.description:
This drain has been blocked for over two years

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 41 Wyman's Lane, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover, 26th November
item.description:
There is a large, double, square manhole cover which has possibly been dislodged and is making a loud clatter every time a vehicle hits it, the noise is very disturbing and is getting worse. Eventually it will crack and cause a real disruption.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Forge House Church Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 25th November
item.description:
Flytipping
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Brockworth Bypass, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous broken paving slab, 24th November
item.description:
Outside 11 Bisley Road, Benhall. Broken slab that many people have tripped over, as it sticks up & is wobbly. It’s only a matter of time before somebody is seriously injured
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17 Bisley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of road signs, 24th November
item.description:
When the A417 Crickley Hill was blocked due to an accident last week an arcticulated lorry trying to find a way around the blockage drove up Dog Lane and became stuck at three places and needed to be towed by tractor at two locations and at 9:30pm by a recovery vehicle. As a very narrow and winding lane with steep sections Dog Lane would benefit from unsuitable for HGV and unsuitable for long vehicle signs at either end.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Smiths Barn Bentham Lane, Bentham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning, 24th November
item.description:
Mud and dead leaves on the lane needs urgent clearing lane becoming dangerous Drivers are complaining and finding access difficult. Please help as this is now an ongoing problem. They could only cut back one side of the hedges etc. This may be due to the difficult conditions. My tel no. 01452 862341. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Green Street, Coopers Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overgrown and will soon bring down phone wires, 23rd November
item.description:
Tree on the corner outside no 7 New Barn Close has been neglected for years and has grown so big it is now tangled in the overhead phone wires. If these wires come down the residents will be without a phone (for how long no-one knows) and some do not have mobiles. BT refuse to do anything and say it is the Council’s responsibility (which it quite rightly is) since the Council own the tree and the land it grows on. The Council did send a work party out recently but all they did was prune a few lower branches.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 New Barn Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging Tree, 23rd November
item.description:
Large Tree which overhangs drive (75) and drops branches in wind and sap in spring/summer on cars underneath. Getting worse each year as no seasonal pruning ever takes place
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 75 Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally modified motorbike exhausts., 22nd November
item.description:
There are several regular motorbikes passing through six ways late at night and in the early hours. Regular traffic noise is not a problem but these illegally modified exhausts are so loud they can be heard for 3-5 minutes as they race through the neighbourhood disturbing hundreds of sleeping residents. Sleep is disturbed with knock on consequences
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 237b London Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loud, rocking manhole lid and damaged manhole li., 22nd November
item.description:
Loud, rocking manhole lid and damaged tarmac - this was fixed earlier this year and has already failed (as it has done a year or 2 previously)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Sandhurst Place London Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 22nd November
item.description:
These potholes are getting worse. They have been there for several months One outside each house number 27 29 snd 31.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 112 Ladysmith Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car Bumper, 21st November
item.description:
There is a complete car bumper left on the grass verge opposite No. 6 Willersey Road, Benhall, Cheltenham. It could easily be knocked onto the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Willersey Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicles blocking pavement, 21st November
item.description:
Pedestrian access blocked by vehicles. The vehicles remain in the same position daily. The situation has been the same for the past 6 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 133 Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blind spot turning left from kate lane to Southan lane, over grown highway on bridge, 20th November
item.description:
I have reported this before yet it still has not been cut back!!! although turning right from Kate lane onto Southam lane has been cut back! But it's a blind spot on 5he junction for people in normal cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Green Orchard Kayte Lane, Southam
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: We have an ongoing problem with rain water coming off the main road .through the village ,Rhodes memorial hall and coming down the lane which is unadopted into our drains .Our drains are not sufficient to deal with the amount of water during a very Harvey downpour .I have to continuously empty the drains on the drive from silt and debris watched down from the main road ..Please can this be investigated weather the, 20th November
item.description:
Please can this be investigate re potentially storm drains being put in at the top of the small lane on the main road . At present I'm at home but are very concerned that if our drains block when I'm away due to the amount of water that comes off the main road , silt etc washed down , it will cause flooding into the property . I have an extremely disabled husband so it is totally my responsibility to deal with any problems

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Rhodes Memorial Hall The Quarry, Brockhampton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mud all over road, 20th November
item.description:
The road is in horrendously muddy state from where the Innsworth builders have an access lane down frog furlong lane it’s getting colder now and will be very dangerous on an unlit road if icy. A road sweeper needs to clean the road and if unable to do so don’t use an as access lane!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Frog Furlong Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
